Igor Ranitovic wrote:
  [Tom Emerson writes:]
>>Igor Ranitovic writes:
>>
>>>>I need to do this in the separate SURT file that I specify in the WUI?
>>>>I'm not including these with the seeds.
>>>
>>>If you are using SurtPrefixedScope or DecidingScope with SurtPrefixedDecideRule than yes, you should 
>>>add + to surts. Both surt and seed files can been mixture of both seeds and SURTs.
>>
>>OK. This is good to know. The documentation, as I remember reading
>>when I was creating my SURTs, didn't imply this. Overall a lot of
>>knowledge about using SURTs is spread through to many
>>documents/messages/wiki entries. The fact that I have to put a '+' in
>>front of the surts in an external SURTs file is counter-intuitive to
>>me.
> 
> 
> I agree. Surts-source-file is counter-intuitive since the file name indicates that the file contains 
> surt prefixes rather than a mixed source of different scope forms (e.g +http://archive.org or 
> +archive.org). However, I think that we should keep '+' as an indicator that conversion to surt 
> prefixes is applied. We should definitely make this clear in the user manual and UI.

This is a bit counterintuitive; the change was made post-1.4 (June 2005).
Before then, the surts-source-file was interpreted strictly as SURT prefixes,
assuming the operator had already SURT-ified any URLs included.

However, the "implicit conversion" being used for seed URLs elsewhere had
proved useful, and indeed I think some operators had tried putting plain
URLs in the surts-source-file and were confused when the same implied
conversion wasn't occurring. So the decision was made to unify the syntax
of the seeds and surts files. In both cases the same SURTs would result,
whereas in the seeds case plain URLs would also become seeds.

Practically, this meant using SurtPrefixSet.importFromMixed() where
previously SurtPrefixSet.importFrom() had been used, and that lines
that were only the be interpreted as pure SURTs had to be prefixed with
a '+'.

This should get better documentation in the manual and web UI hints; I've
made an RFE for such improvement:
  http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1436290&group_id=73833&atid=539102

- Gordon @ IA
